1.a: Jude was a servant of Jesus Christ.
1.q: Of whom was Jude a servant?

1.a: Jude was the brother of James.
1.q: Who was the brother of Jude?

1.a: He wrote to those who were called, beloved in God the Father, and kept for Jesus Christ.
1.q: To whom did Jude write?

1.a: Jude wanted mercy, peace, and love to be multiplied.
1.q: What did Jude want multiplied to those to whom he wrote?

1.a: Jude first wanted to write about their common salvation.
1.q: What did Jude first want to write about?

1.a: Jude actually wrote about the need to struggle for the faith of the saints.
1.q: What did Jude actually write about?

1.a: Some condemned and ungodly men came stealthily.
1.q: How did some condemned and ungodly men come?

1.a: They changed the grace of God into sexual immorality and denied Jesus Christ.
1.q: What did the condemned and ungodly men do?

1.a: The Lord saved them from the land of Egypt.
1.q: From where did the Lord once save people?

1.a: The Lord destroyed those people who did not believe.
1.q: What did the Lord do to those people who did not believe?

1.a: The Lord put them in chains in darkness for judgment.
1.q: What did the Lord do to the angels who left their proper place?

1.a: They fornicated and pursued unnatural desires.
1.q: What did Sodom, Gomorrah, and the cities around them do?

1.a: They pollute their bodies in their dreams, reject authority, and say evil things.
1.q: Like Sodom, Gomorrah, and the cities around them, what do the condemned and ungodly men do?

1.a: The archangel Michael said, "May the Lord rebuke you."
1.q: What did the archangel Michael say to the devil?

1.a: They shamelessly care for themselves.
1.q: For whom do the condemned and ungodly men shamelessly care?

1.a: The Lord will execute judgment upon all people.
1.q: Upon whom will the Lord execute judgment?

1.a: Enoch was the seventh in line from Adam.
1.q: Enoch was which place in line from Adam?

1.a: Grumblers, complainers, those who go after their evil desires, loud boasters, and those who praise for personal advantage are the ungodly men who will be convicted.
1.q: Who are the ungodly men who will be convicted?

1.a: The apostles of the Lord Jesus Christ spoke words in the past about mockers.
1.q: Who spoke words in the past about mockers?

1.a: They do not have the Holy Spirit.
1.q: What is true of the mockers who go after the own ungodly lusts, who cause divisions and are sensual?

1.a: The beloved were building themselves up in their most holy faith, and praying in the Holy Spirit.
1.q: How were the beloved building themselves up and praying?

1.a: The beloved were to keep themselves in and look for the love of God, and the mercy of the Lord Jesus Christ.
1.q: What were the beloved to keep themselves in and look for?

1.a: The beloved were supposed to have mercy on and save those who were in doubt or with a garment spotted by the flesh, and those in the fire.
1.q: Who were the beloved supposed to have mercy on and save?

1.a: God was able to keep them from stumbling and place them before the presence of his glory without blemish.
1.q: What was God their Savior, through Jesus Christ their Lord, able to do?

1.a: God had glory before all time, now, and forevermore.
1.q: When did God have glory?
